intro: Marsdenia gondarensis, commonly known as the Gondar Marsdenia, is a flowering plant species native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with a unique corona that resembles a crown. Marsdenia gondarensis is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
